summary: This is an internal email from the Associate Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, dated August 10, 2019, seeking clarification to finalize a press release regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It contains specific questions and answers about the circumstances of his death, the response by staff and EMS, and details of his incarceration and charges.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate who was found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York on the morning of August 10, 2019, and was later pronounced dead at a hospital. He was indicted for sex trafficking.

persons.name: Associate Warden MCC New York
persons.context: The author of the email, working with IPPA to finalize a press release about Epstein's death and seeking answers to specific procedural and factual questions.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:30 am. Staff initiated life-saving measures. EMS arrived and, along with BOP staff, transported him to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead at approximately 7:36 am.

events.title: Epstein's Arrival at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein first arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on July 6, 2019, as indicated on his PP37 form.

locations: MCC New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York at approximately 6:30 am on August 10, 2019.
Staff initiated life-saving measures upon finding him. EMS arrived and, along with BOP staff, transported him to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead at approximately 7:36 am.
The FBI was notified of the incident. The document implies an investigation into the death, with a question asking if it is being investigated as a suicide.
Epstein first arrived at MCC New York on July 6, 2019. His specific indictments were for Sex Trafficking Conspiracy and Sex Trafficking of Minors.
At the time of the correspondence, Epstein's next of kin had not been notified.
